definition: person (first person, second person etc in grammar)/called/known as

sentences.english: This chapter of Tao Te Ching is usually being called Great Conformity.
sentences.chinese: 這篇道德經一般人稱之謂大順。

sentences.english: This book is really Juliette's story, told in the third person.
sentences.chinese: 全書實際上是以第三人稱敘述了朱麗葉的故事。

sentences.english: The second chapter is the personal pronoun in Jiaozhou Dialect.
sentences.chinese: 第二章研究膠州話中的人稱代詞。

sentences.english: People who go begging for money or food are called beggars .
sentences.chinese: 那些乞討錢或食物的人稱作爲乞丐。

sentences.english: Under normal circumstances, honorifics completely replaced by the person.
sentences.chinese: 在一般情況下，敬語完全取代了人稱。

sentences.english: The cause was complications of cancer, his family said.
sentences.chinese: 其家人稱，楊向中博士死於癌症併發症。

sentences.english: Today, I met my boyfriend's notoriously difficult mother.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我見到了男朋友那人稱鬼見愁的老媽。

sentences.english: The Singaporeans argue that they have the perfect compromise between accountability and efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡人稱他們在責任與效率之間達成了最好的折衷。

sentences.english: The man says that he will be wearing a red baseball cap.
sentences.chinese: 那人稱他會戴一頂紅色棒球帽。

sentences.english: Formal invitations are usually issued and accepted in the third person.
sentences.chinese: 正式邀請書通常以第三人稱的身分發出和接受。

sentences.english: Try to Remember idioms and sentences with the first calling, make sure to remember deeply.
sentences.chinese: 儘量用第一人稱來記習慣用語和句型，以便記憶牢固。

sentences.english: Sources close to Tang Jitian say he has been severely tortured.
sentences.chinese: 接近唐吉田的消息人稱唐吉田受到嚴重酷刑。

sentences.english: A verb must agree with its subject in number and person.
sentences.chinese: 在數和人稱方面動詞必須與其主詞一致。

sentences.english: Another said that Zalmai was protected by a foreign security company.
sentences.chinese: 另有人稱宰裏邁被一家外國保安公司保護。

sentences.english: The doctor weighed the two men in.
sentences.chinese: 醫生給那兩個人稱體重。

sentences.english: Yi-person payments, a strong money February 26.
sentences.chinese: 弋人稱金，得二兩六錢強。

definition: called/to call sth (by a name)/to name
not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
to gallop/to assist/to attack/to wade/great/old variant of 憑|凭[ping2]
legendary/fantasy saga/romance/short stories of the Tang and Song Dynasty
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
to be collectively called/collective term/general designation
